name: Charles CANN, II, Appellant, v. BERWICK AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT
name_abbreviation: Cann v. Berwick Area School District

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ.
LARSEN and FLAHERTY, JJ., dissent and would reach the merits.
parties: Charles CANN, II, Appellant, v. BERWICK AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
LARSEN and FLAHERTY, JJ., dissent and would reach the merits.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: A. Stephen Cohen, Aston, for appellant.
Robert E. Bull, Berwick, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
445 A.2d 97
Charles CANN, II, Appellant, v. BERWICK AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued April 13, 1982.
Decided May 19, 1982.
A. Stephen Cohen, Aston, for appellant.
Robert E. Bull, Berwick, for appellee.
Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ.
